utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: So I'm thinking 35.

utterance.speaker: Marco
utterance.content: Seems high to me.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: That's a fair price for quality like this.

utterance.speaker: Marco
utterance.content: I'll give you 30.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: What? I thought you were joking. I didn't...

utterance.speaker: Marco
utterance.content: Who am I dealing with here, Eddie? Him or you?

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Mickey, relax. Now, if things move forward with Gorski, he lets us into Philly, then maybe I cut you a break.

utterance.speaker: Marco
utterance.content: You cut me a break now, or maybe you don't get with Gorski.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Marco... I thought we had an understanding. Whoa, whoa.

utterance.speaker: Marco
utterance.content: Tommy, don't be stupid. Put the gun down.

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: First, he shows you some respect.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: Hey, you just – just listen to your boss, all right, moron?

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: You shut up!

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: Just relax, buddy.

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: Agh! Oh, God!

utterance.speaker: Marco
utterance.content: What the hell were you thinking?

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: I didn't shoot him!

utterance.speaker: Marco
utterance.content: Are you sure? Look at him. He's face-down on the pavement!

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: I nailed myself in the foot! God!

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: I–I don't think he's hit.

utterance.speaker: Marco
utterance.content: Then what happened?

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: Let's get outta here!

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Come on, Mickey, wake up. Mickey! Wake up!

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: We almost done here?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Assuming you did this shaving your forehead... Okay, then. I'm ordering a head C.T.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: No, I don't have a headache. I'm not dizzy. Eddie, I gotta get back.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: You gotta stay here. We'll straighten out that mess with Marco tomorrow. Let the doc do his job.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Actually, stitching you up is really the E.R. doc's job.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: Yeah. Too long of a wait.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. Also, a lot of cops in the E.R. Not that you care about that. So how did this happen? Yeah, you're right. That was a stupid question. 'Cause the answer's kind of obvious. No scrapes on your hands means you didn't try to break your fall. Means either out cold or totally disoriented when you went down. No sign of trauma other than the cut means no one hit you in the head. Powder burn on your jacket sleeve means someone shot a gun.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: All right, Eddie. Come on, let's go.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't care what you guys are into. If you don't get this checked out, it'll happen again.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Whoa. What will?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This. Cool.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 32-year-old man, recent developed loud-noise-induced vertigo. C.T. was clean. No internal bleeding, no edema. Everything else is in the file. Cameron get your hair in the divorce?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: This guy strained his back three years ago. And that's it. All the rest of these pages are blank.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes, he won't tell us anything. Understandable, since he's a drug dealer.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: So he's dangerous and withholding, which you find irresistible. But guys like that, they never call.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He actually said he was a drug dealer?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not out loud. But he was wearing a solid gold Patek Philippe. His friend had a Rolex. But their phones were prepaid burners, so they can toss 'em as soon as they're done.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It doesn't matter if this guy's a drug dealer or not. Noise-induced vertigo means ear or brain. Head C.T. was clean, so I'm thinking acoustic neuroma. We need to do an A.B.R. to test his hearing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Acoustic neuroma fits. So does lidocaine toxicity. Or benzocaine – depends what he's cutting the coke with.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: So now he's not just a drug dealer, he's a cocaine dealer.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He seemed peppy. You test his ears. I'm gonna go test his cocaine.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You think this guy's just gonna hand over a briefcase full of illegal drugs because you ask nicely?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I hope not.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So the best coffee's at Geena's, and the best pizza is at Gino's.

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: Yeah, and don't mix those up, because the coffee at Gino's could kill ya.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And how's the drycleaner on the corner?

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: Go two blocks over to Eco-Clean. The one on the corner used to shred all my boyfriend's shirts.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Good to know.

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: In retrospect, I should really thank those cleaners. We broke up. This is my stop.

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: So if you have any more questions about the neighborhood, I'm your girl.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Uh, favorite sushi place. Maybe we could get dinner sometime.

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: Sure... if you promise to bring that good-looking guy with the cane.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You mean House?

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: Your boyfriend's name is House?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: H–he's not my boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: Oh... Heh, I'm sorry. Wh-what do you call each other? Husband? Partner? Lover?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: We're not gay.

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're gonna hear a series of clicks and hisses. Sensors measure electronic activity to your auditory nerve.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: How long is this gonna take?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: An hour, maybe an hour and a half. Or you could walk away with a tumor in your ear.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Guy's probably late to a stabbing.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Impedances look good. Starting at 13 clicks per second at 50 decibels. Check this out.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Thirteen's middle name is Beauregard? Wave three latency is 3.8.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Slightly delayed, but nothing significant. That's what sticks out to you? House is clearly screwing with us. It's a fake paystub.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Looks real to me.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: There's no way she makes that much money.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I make that much money. And... apparently, you don't.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I need the drugs.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: We're in textiles.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I need the drugs! Hmm... works for Jack Bauer.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Is this really necessary? The chairs in the hall are way more comfortable.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But way less genre-appropriate. Okay, here's the deal. I need information. You have reasons not to give me that information. So either I can force it out of you... or I can't.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: I wish I could tell ya.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay... Well, let's work with that. Forget the drugs. Let's talk about textiles. What's your major product? Is it "h"? And by that I mean "hosiery."

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: We do more with... culottes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is that with a "c" or a "k"?

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: "C." Nobody wants "k" anymore.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Does your friend cut the fabric?

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: No, he's a sales guy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, he must cut a culotte here and there.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: No one touches the culottes.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm sorry. Can I talk to you for a second?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm interrogating a suspect. Make it quick.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Everyone in our building thinks we're gay.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We're grown men over the age of 30 who moved in together. We're two tigers away from an act in Vegas. They'll figure out we're straight eventually.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Eventually is not when I want to go out with the cute girl in 3-B.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Any chance I could get some water over here?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If only there was some way to communicate that information to her. Perhaps using, I don't know, sounds. If only the larynx was capable of –

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She didn't believe me. She sidestepped my dinner invite.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And a woman would only reject you because she's worried that you might not be interested in her.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: We were chatting, having fun. There was definitely a spark.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: When she thought you were gay. You sure your friend isn't secretly tr – What is a culotte, anyway?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Pants that hang like a skirt. Just...

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Mickey hates the stuff. He's one of the few guys I trust to watch the product overnight. They took him away an hour ago. You think he's okay?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's an ear test. Pretty sure he'll live.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Pupils are constricted. Pulse is bounding!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Airway's clear. Need a crash cart in here!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Gotta be his blood pressure. We need to get it down before he strokes out!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: At least we know his ears are okay.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We put the patient on vasodilators, got his hypertension under control.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He got worse here at the hospital. Means thug life probably isn't what's making him sick.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Which means we can stop the bloodhound gang routine and go back to being doctors.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But we're doctors all the time. It's so boring. Fine.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Could be sick sinus syndrome.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No chest pain, shortness of breath. Brain aneurysm secondary to polycystic kidney disease?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Normal urinalysis. Kidney's impalpable. Is... that a new watch?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Thought I'd give myself a little treat. What if it's not his brain, but it's on the way to his brain? Carotid stenosis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Get an ultrasound of his carotids. See if his arteries are clogged.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: How much money do you make?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I want a raise.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: And I will be happy to talk about that at your next review... in August.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I know that you're paying me less than everyone else on the team.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I can't discuss other people's salaries. You know that.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Now that they know I'm making less than they are, they'll never respect me.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: And who told them how much you make?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's not fair for me to make less than the people I supervise.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Salary isn't about fairness. It's about what you can leverage in negotiation. Which isn't much without a competing offer on the table. And we both know you don't have one.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Ultrasound showed no narrowing or obstruction in the patient's carotid.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Not that he's worried – keeps asking me when he can leave.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: A place in the business of healing people, you'd think they'd have better chicken soup.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You bugged his room?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Our patient sleeps in the building where they keep their stash. Eventually, he'll say something that gives away where that is. And we'll find out what's making him sick.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: But we ruled out environmental causes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You ruled out environmental causes.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And you pretended to agree, just so we'd take him out of his room so you could plant the bug.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Carotid stenosis was a decent idea. But an even decent-er idea is that he's got toxins stored in his fat cells. Every calorie he burns makes him sicker.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If we're going with toxic exposure, we should just start testing for the most likely suspects.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Bug's a better idea than blindly running tests for days.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Tell him it'll take weeks. It'll be faster.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: What do you mean weeks?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: These tests take time. There are a lot of possibilities.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: No, but I-I can't sit here this long. I got things I gotta take care of.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If you're worried about all the poor school children going without their drugs, I'm sure someone –

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: I wanna be discharged.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'll get the forms.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: This is ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Beats sitting in a lab all day.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: In the lab there is significantly less chance of getting killed. You're too close. Slow down.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We're in a car in broad daylight. What's gonna happen?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You honestly think he doesn't have a gun in that car?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: That he's gonna use to shoot doctors?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Just... back off. Hey, well played with the watch, by the way.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Borrowed it from a friend.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How much longer are we gonna keep lying to him?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Until it's no longer fun. We all thought he needed to be taken down a few notches.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So we're just having fun, not getting even?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Oh, crap.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He's gonna get away.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 3-B? You're Nora, right? My roommate tells me you're the one to thank for all the tips about the neighborhood. Greg.

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: Nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I hear you thought that Wilson and I liked to polish each other's swords. And by swords, I mean pistols.

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: Of course he told you about that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, don't worry. Actually, I'm surprised that doesn't happen more often. We're both straight. Oh, my... God, that is beautiful. We finally have the room to display it the way it deserves. Would you – would you help me get this upstairs?

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nice shoes, by the way. Louboutin?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You talk to Cuddy?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Shot me down.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So, uh, what are you gonna do now?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'll wait for my review in August.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Nothing. That's what I would do. But I'm a coward.

utterance.speaker: Yvette
utterance.content: His friend brought him in 15 minutes ago. Temp's 105. Pulse is weak and thready.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: He's not making any sense.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: It's too much money, Eddie. That wasn't the deal. That wasn't the deal.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Is he gonna be okay?

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: Eddie!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We gave him antipyretics and soft steroids to reduce the fever and prevent organ damage. He's no longer delirious.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Patient went out, came back worse than before. Points us back to environmental, tied to wherever he went.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, it doesn't. Where's Foreman?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He had a meeting with Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What do you mean, "No, it doesn't"? We screwed up the tail. My car was impounded.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: True, amusing, and irrelevant. Foreman fall for the paycheck thing?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Uh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Mazel tov. Should be fun to watch.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You're off environmental?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wherever he went, it wasn't for long enough. Add in the fever and infection's way more likely. And if it is an infection, his symptoms suggest it's moved to his brain. Which means...

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'll do a lumbar puncture.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: Next time you're tailing someone, take two cars.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You knew we were following you?

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I had to lose you. I had business to take care of.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Right, because you're a businessman. Do you know how many junkies come into the E.R. every week with their brains melting?

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: I'll bet there's more drunks with their livers giving out. A liquor store owner laying on this table – I'm guessing he doesn't get attitude. Aah!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I hit bone. His old back injury must have flattened out his discs. Sorry, but I've got to try this again. You okay?

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: Yeah. An adult wants to get wasted, why is it anybody's business what substance they use?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Because some of those substances are against the law.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: So your problem isn't that it's immoral. Your problem is that it's illegal. I got the same problem.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm in.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Look at his heart rate.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's normal.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I ran into Nora this morning. She told me about your Evita listening party.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The London and New York recordings are so different.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You were supposed to tell her that we're straight.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She didn't believe me, either.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're doing this to mess with me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Correction – I started doing this to mess with you. Now I'm honestly trying to hit that.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: By pretending you're gay and in a relationship with me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We're in a relationship and we're really unhappy. Communication's never been easy for us. Probably 'cause we're so closeted. I got it all figured out. Nora and I spend the next few weeks hanging out, become best girlfriends. I confide in her about our issues.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I can't decide if this plan is more despicable or illogical.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Then, one night, we get drunk... back rub turns into a front rub... The next morning, "I've never felt this way about a woman before."

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That's... quite a commitment you've made to jumping the girl I'd like to date.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'd like to date her. In the sense that I'd like to jump her repeatedly.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I saw her first.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Seriously? You're invoking the guy code?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: We're guys. It's a code.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're only bringing this up 'cause you know you're gonna lose.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's not an infection, but it might be an autonomic nerve disorder.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The hair is still bumping me. Did you get it cut because you're ready for the next chapter or –

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We stuck a needle into his spinal bodies twice. His heart rate stayed normal. If we add that to his other symptoms...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That would be a mistake.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She's never gonna fall for it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, then, you got nothing to worry about, sweetie.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're a wuss.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: Say that when I'm better.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What, are you gonna beat me up? That sounds stressful. Maybe you should pop one of your beta blockers first.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You have a heart problem?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Medically, no. He would have told us about that. Metaphorically...

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: It's an effect from operating outside of the law. Sometimes, I have to do bad things. And not always to bad people. Last few months, that hasn't been so easy. A guy got me the pills. And they control the stress. Look, don't – don't say anything to Eddie. All right? The last thing I need is the guys thinking that I've gone soft.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: When was your last pill before we originally admitted you?

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: Um, the night before.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And we stuck you in here, and you went into beta blocker withdrawal. That's what caused the hypertension. When he got out of here, he took another pill, and the hypertension went away. Which means it was never a symptom. We take that off the table, we've got vertigo, fever...

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: …and stress. He's been in this game for a while. Either he grew a conscience over the last few months or he's producing excess adrenaline.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pheochromocytoma.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's Greek for, "You'll be back doing bad things to good people in no time." M.R.I. his adrenal glands. You're okay with that, right? You're not gonna put a pillow over his face?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh, great. Cable guy came.

utterance.speaker: Woman on TV
utterance.content: You know what? It's going good. How about I just learn to keep people out of our business? And that's the real thing.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: Hi, James. We've got some kung pao left. Oh! God. Right there. Oh. Oh.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We're having a picnic... with wine.

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: I'll pour you a glass.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He doesn't drink.

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: Oh. Well, more for us, then.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well... I think I might... have a little... kung pao.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: How'd it go with Cuddy?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She told me I needed leverage. So, I told her about an offer I had to help run the neuro department at Mercy.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Wow. Are you really gonna take the job?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: There is no other job. I bluffed. She called it. I'm not gonna beg to be underpaid. I'm leaving when this case is over.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House is lying to you.

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: I know. And so are you. It's 2010, I mean... You know, nobody cares if you're gay anymore. I mean, you don't have to be in the closet.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm not, I... Look around you. Does this really look like a place gay men live? A-apart from the poster. Those stools are our only furniture. There are no window treatments.

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: Well, my ex-boyfriend didn't even know what window treatments were. Is that Greg's Carpenters album or yours?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Look, House hates musicals and fashion and meringue. This whole thing is an act designed to earn your trust... in order to sleep with you.

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: I get it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Finally.

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: You're jealous. You know, if you want to spend more time with Greg, you should just tell him.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You were wrong. M.R.I. revealed no sign of a pheochromocytoma, which means Mickey's stress is just stress. We're back to vertigo and fever.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And environmental is back at the top of our list of suspects. We're trying to narrow down the possibilities.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That receiver doesn't respond to manual stimulation. Maybe if you took off your shirt.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Actually, I resorted to something more exotic. I call it reading the instructions. Turns out if you screw the antennae into the wrong sockets, it doesn't actually work.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We lost Mickey just outside Trenton.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It's supposed to search for an open frequency.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Most buildings there were built between 1920 and 1940. We're compiling a list of toxins most common –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There's got to be at least one open frequency.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I need a few minutes with your friend. Or stay if you want. Rectal exam.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: I'll check out the cafeteria.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why the beta blockers?

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Valium and Xanax actually reduce stress. Beta blockers just control the symptoms of stress.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: Whoa.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Keep the heart from racing, hands from shaking, and all those stage fright issues. That's why some people take them when they perform.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: What the hell is that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This is my bug. And this...

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: Um...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This... This is yours.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You bugged your own room? Are you... an informant?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: An informant would have sold his pals out to us at the first sign of a sniffle. This guy... is a cop.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I don't see how this is relevant.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: In the land of no fun, you got a really sensible piece of property.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Give him a break. Knowing this guy's an undercover cop doesn't get us any closer to curing him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good point. You know what they say. Information is not power. Wait...

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You're saying we should use the cop thing to force him to talk?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Force? I'm talking about the womanly art of persuasion. I said womanly.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: If you won't talk to us, we'll find someone who will. I mean, you must have a supervisor. A... handler.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: Good luck with that. You don't know my real name. You don't know if I'm local or state, F.B.I., D.E.A. But, by all means, get on the phone.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I get it. These guys are lowlifes. You want off the street.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: They're not just lowlifes. Eddie killed a snitch three weeks ago. Boss' orders. The-the boss, he's one of the biggest cocaine importers in the entire state. And he wants to expand down to Philly. Tomorrow night, he and Eddie are meeting the big fish. And the cops are gonna bust it. But if you guys get caught poking around there, the whole thing gets called off.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: That's noble, but you can't put your life at risk.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: I've been undercover for 16 months. I haven't seen my wife... my house, my dog. I have put far too much into this, and I will not let it fail. So just... just keep me alive for another 24 hours. And I will tell you everything you need to know.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Hey. Uh, can I come in? Nurses out here can't keep their hands off of me.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: He's a Casanova, huh? What, you bringing me my sandwich?

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: No, because, guess what. I don't read minds. You okay?

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: Aggh! Gah! Aaaa!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He had a G.I. infarction caused by a clot in his superior mesenteric artery. We had to remove a foot of bowel.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Any more clots keep forming, he may not last 24 hours.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And the moron still won't talk.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Bad guy, cool; good guy, moron?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pretty much.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Guy's a hero. He's risking his life to put these dealers in jail.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm sure the dealers who take their places will be very grateful.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So vertigo, fever, and thrombosis. We've already ruled out cancer and infection. He got worse on steroids, which suggests it's not autoimmune. So we're stuck with environmental.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: But what kind of environmentals? Toxins, parasites, allergens.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We should just pick the top ten possibilities and treat for all of them.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Except that treating for everything could kill him faster than whatever's killing him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Got a better idea?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Sort of. Chase is right. Our patient is holding out for noble reasons: protecting his bust. Anybody else on that crew got sick, I'm guessing they'd be a little more self-serving.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Surgery went well. You'll be able to see him soon.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Yeah, used to be all about Ferberizing your kid. Now they're saying it could mess them up. Heh. My – mine's six and a half.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Mickey's getting worse. The clot is a very bad sign. We really need you to tell us where he's been.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Heh. I do that, there's a very good chance that I could end up John Doe at the county M.E.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Look, Mickey got sick because he had the most exposure. Other guys are at risk too. You don't want to... You okay?

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: I – I feel dizzy.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Are you diabetic?

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: When was the last time you were at your office?

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Whoa... did you drug me?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: You're trying to make me think that I'm sick so I'll take you to the stash.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Of course not, but if you are sick –

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: No, I don't feel sick. I feel drugged! Trust me, I know the difference.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You didn't even drink half of it. You'll be fine in an hour.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: You think Mickey could die? Ah, it's just a deal. I'll take you.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Couldn't have given us a heads up that he was living

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Is that it? Can we get out of here?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I gotta cover all our bases.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Look... back there. Hurry up.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What are these, more chemicals?

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Oh, not exactly. Uh... If this stuff was the problem, there'd be a lot more sick people. Did you call the cops?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: No one's supposed to be here.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Come here. I said no kissing!

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: Eddie. I didn't know you'd be here.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Um... uh...

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Look, the deal was just for you. This guy wants to watch, it's an extra 50.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Yeah, private party, man. Uh... I got it covered tonight. Nice.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The jealousy is... killing me.

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: Well... he clearly cares about you. Very much.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why can't he show it in a – in a normal way? I'm so tired of... the whole silence and the resentment. I don't know if I can go back there tonight. I need some time.

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: Come stay at my place.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. It'll be fun. You know, like a – like a sleepover.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That would – that would be... It would be such a help. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm here because...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nothing you can say is going to change anything.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I love this man. And I am not wasting another moment of my life denying that. Gregory House... will you marry me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wow. This is unexpected.

utterance.speaker: Lady
utterance.content: Say yes!

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: I'm gonna go.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No – no, no, no.

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: You two obviously have some talking to do. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How's it coming?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So far, nothing. Carpet, paint, insulation. Even the gross food in the fridge. Everything's coming up clean.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Which leaves the dry-cleaning chemicals. Should have the results in a few minutes.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Foreman's already started him on inhaled albuterol. Chances are, this case is over.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We have to tell him.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We can't tell him. Won't change the fact that Cuddy let him walk. It'll just let him know it was all because of a stupid prank.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We have to tell Cuddy. We confess and beg her to take him back.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If begging worked, he would have a raise, and we wouldn't be screwed.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Albuterol is not helping. Patient started coughing blood.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What about adding ipratropium? That might –

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Don't bother. We assumed this place was using perchloroethylene. Turns out... petroleum solvents.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The drug dealers are running a green drycleaner?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I hate to push past the irony, but our patient's bleeding into his lungs, and we've got nothing.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The V/Q scan last night showed a pulmonary aneurysm. Explains the coughing blood. I did an embolization to stop the bleeding, he then started up again this morning. Three more aneurysms.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Those look like mycotic aneurysms. Indicates a fungal infection.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That'd be consistent with his other symptoms: the vertigo, the fever.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I didn't see any fungus at the location, and none of the samples –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Looks like somebody missed something. Which is embarrassing for somebody.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: And... the steroids we gave him would have suppressed his immune system. If that was a fungus, he'd have 30 aneurysms.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Somebody's got a good point.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: One bleed to four in less than 12 hours? That seems like an uptick to me.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We need to start him on antifungal meds before he drowns in his own blood.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do it.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: How long till it starts working?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Give it a few hours. I’ll be back to check on you.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: There you go. Take it easy.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: You shouldn't have taken her there, you imbecile. They found nothing. You could have got your brains blown out.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: I had to do something. I couldn't just sit and watch and... You're my friend.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: You'd do it for me. Ah. I... I should get going. Got the big man from Philly coming in tonight. You want me to stay, I'll stay. Jimmy knows everything that we know.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: No. The six months we put in on this... You gotta be there.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: I'll swing by tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: Hey, Eddie.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: I'm sorry. You know that... I can't go with you.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It was all our fault.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We were screwing with Foreman, trying to make him think he made less than we did. Obviously, things got out of control.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well, someone does something stupid and insensitive, I always figure it was House. Good to know it's catching.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Look, there is no other job. He was just trying to get a raise. Even if you gave him a little more money, I know he'd stay.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm not giving Foreman a raise because the three of you decided to amuse yourselves.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We know, and that's why we want you to take it out of our paychecks.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You two okay with this?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Is there any other option?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We're okay with it. Foreman is a good team leader. He deserves it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Okay, then. That is what I will do. And just so you know... I have no idea what you're talking about. I haven't seen Foreman in three days.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The phrase "who's your daddy?" comes to mind.

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: Want to grab some coffee?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Kind of a bad time.

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: Sorry. Uh, you told me to drop by, so... This is when I could make it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right. This whole thing with Wilson... It's all my fault. We're not closeted, because we're not gay. For real. Wilson thought you were cute, and I was just yanking his chain. Maybe that's not the best phrasing.

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: So you were only spending time with me to screw with him?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: God, no. I was spending time with you because I want to touch your boobs. Enough to listen to Evita, twice. And I really hate Evita. That's how much I like your boobs. Wait. Whoa, whoa, whoa. Wait, wait. Wilson... he's a really good guy. And he really likes you.

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: Well, it's really... It's sweet of you to stick up for your friend like that. And you're still trying to sleep with me. You know, maybe I will call him. It would serve you right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wilson's a jerk too.

utterance.speaker: Nora
utterance.content: Well, at least he tried to do the right thing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's been divorced three times. He slept with a dying patient. Sure, he looks like a boy scout, but then...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The aneurysms look mycotic, but they're not. They're inflammatory. Because this is not a fungal infection. The hypertension was a real symptom. You've been unwittingly treating it with beta blockers. You stopped taking them, and your blood pressure went up. It's Hughes-Stovin.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: Okay, so how – how do we treat this?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We don't. Hughes-Stovin is an autoimmune disease. Once it's this advanced, there's not much we can do. The aneurysms keep multiplying. Eventually... one of them will rupture.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you die in the next day or so, I will be.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Even if you had told us everything we wanted to know, it wouldn't have made a difference. You did the right thing.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: I think I should call my wife now.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm sorry about your patient.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He died a hero in his own mind. Guess it's better than nothing.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Ran into Nora in the elevator. She no longer thinks we're gay. Now she thinks we're mendacious dirt bags.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Mendacious dirt bag comes much more naturally to me. Least we can get rid of that.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I kind of like it. Unlike this sofa.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's 500 bucks. And... it reclines.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I will punch you in the face.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'll stop, if you get rid of the sofa.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No chance.
